author: bkamisar@thehill.com (Ben Kamisar)
title: Obama praises recently axed Chicago Bulls coach
text:
May 28, 2015, 02:16 pm Obama praises fired Chicago Bulls coach Getty 
President Obama departed from a Twitter chat on climate change Thursday to address the tenuous state of his hometown Chicago Bulls, which just fired its head coach. 
Tweeting from his new @POTUS account, he expressed solidarity with former coach Tom Thibodeau hours after the Bulls announced his dismissal in a statement. ADVERTISEMENT “Love thibs and think he did a great job,” Obama said, referring to the popular coach who clashed with team management. 
“Sorry to see him go but expect he will be snatched up soon by another team.” 
The Obama administration’s has supported Thibodeau since before he became the Bull’s head coach after a stint as an assistant with the Boston Celtics. Team owner Jerry Reinsdorf told the Chicago-Sun Times in 2011 that Secretary of Education Arne Duncan, a former Harvard basketball player, first recommended that the team hire Thibodeau to lead the team. 
When the team finally chose Thibodeau, both Obama and his senior adviser David Axelrod congratulated Reinsdorf and told him he had made a good choice. 
And despite the tension between the team and its coach, Obama praised Thibodeau during a radio spot on ESPN Radio last December.
